intro: Centaurea atropurpurea, commonly known as purplehead centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its striking purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, and it is often found in dry, rocky soils. Centaurea atropurpurea is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers.
